Procurement Officer Job at African Industries Group (AIG)




        
    

        
        African Industries Group (AIG) is a diversified global conglomerate with a legacy of 54 years of business excellence and sustainable growth. It is headquartered in Lagos, Nigeria. It has been contributing to Nigeria’s socio-economic growth and industrial development and is equally committed to the nurturing and development of the local community.

AIG owes its success to the core philosophy of ‘Building the Future Together’. Its business strategy is inclusive, and sustainable, and not only benefits stakeholders but also positively impacts the environment and society.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer
     

            
    



Job Location: Gujeni, Kaduna
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Monitor stock position of Point of Sales materials usage and ensure re-order/deliveries as at when due.
	Build and maintain good relationships with existing and potential foreign and local suppliers.
	Identify foreign material stocks requiring replenishment, and ensure re-order as at when due.
	Monitor LC processing for orders up to confirmation stage by beneficiaries.
	Evaluate potential suppliers’ proposals and recommend those with quality materials at competitive prices.
	Maintain and analyze records of purchases, quotations, price options and related data.
	Obtain daily sales reports from Sales Team, document and analyze the sales trend, and forecast foreign materials that need to be provided.
	Negotiate the best prices for purchase orders of foreign materials with the right quality, etc.


Minimum Requirements


	First Degree or its equivalent in Purchasing & Supply, Accounting, Statistics or related disciplines.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in procurement function.
	Professional certifications in Supply Chain Management is an added advantage
	Strong Analytical, and numerical skills with proven problem- identification and solution abilities.
	Have in-depth knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite with a focus on Excel skills
	Experience in FMCG industry is an added advantage.


Mehod of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: elizabeth.ehi@anrml.com using "Procurement Officer Application"  as the subject of the email.

  "description": "Trinity Financial is a limited liability company duly incorporated in Nigeria under the 2002 Companies and Allied Matters Act. licensed and supervised by the Central Bank of Nigeria as a full-fledged Financial Service Firm.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Managing Director - Stock Brokerage
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Managing Director (MD) will oversee the strategic direction, operational performance, and regulatory compliance of the stock brokerage firm.
	This role is responsible for driving business growth, maintaining client confidence, ensuring market integrity, and leading a high-performing team of brokers, traders, and analysts.
	The MD will work closely with stakeholders, regulatory bodies, and institutional and retail clients to achieve both financial and strategic objectives.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Leadership:


	Develop and implement the firm&rsquo;s vision, mission, and long-term strategy in line with market opportunities.
	Identify new business lines, market segments, and investment products to expand the firm&rsquo;s portfolio.
	Monitor industry trends and competitor activity to maintain a competitive advantage.


Operational Management:


	Oversee daily operations of the brokerage, ensuring efficiency and risk management.
	Implement and enforce compliance frameworks aligned with financial market regulations (e.g., SEC, FINRA, or local regulatory bodies).
	Manage financial performance, budgets, and P&amp;L accountability.


Client &amp; Stakeholder Relations:


	Build and maintain relationships with institutional investors, high-net-worth clients, and strategic partners.
	Oversee client acquisition and retention strategies to maximize assets under management (AUM).
	Represent the firm in industry events, media, and public relations engagements.


Team Leadership &amp; Development:


	Lead, mentor, and motivate senior management, brokers, and support staff.
	Foster a culture of high ethical standards, transparency, and performance.
	Establish clear KPIs and performance evaluation systems.


Risk &amp; Compliance Oversight:


	Ensure strict adherence to trading regulations, anti-money laundering (AML) standards, and risk management protocols.
	Review and approve high-value transactions and investment recommendations.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in finance, economics, business administration, or a related field (master&rsquo;s/MBA preferred).
	Minimum 10+ years of experience in stock brokerage, investment banking, and asset management, with at least 5 years in an executive leadership role.
	Valid securities and brokerage licenses as required by the jurisdiction.
	Strong knowledge of equity markets, trading strategies, investment products, and compliance regulations.
	Exceptional leadership, negotiation, and strategic planning skills.
	Proven track record of driving revenue growth and profitability.
	Highly experienced in marketing and investment.
	The candidate should not be less than 40 years old


Other Requirements:


	Skill in dealing with public and private sectors in Nigeria.
	Understanding of the business models of financial services organizations.
	Experience with capital/fundraising nationally &amp; internationally.
	Proven excellent track record of achievement in this role or a similar role in a dynamic corporate environment.
	Registered as a sponsored individual with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
	Ability to think strategically whilst maintaining a pragmatic perspective.
	Ability to build and nurture strategic business relationships.
	Ability to provide business acumen, energy, and vision to the organization.
	In-depth understanding of the impact of changes/trends in the financial services industry.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;trinityfinancialng01@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Job Summary


	The Assistant General Manager of Production at Dangote Group will be responsible for monitoring and coordination of all activities related to the poeration of the kiln and coal mills to achieve production and quality targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Responsible for meeting production volumes budget for the year
	Responsible for SHC, SPC and fuel mix as per budget.

	Oversee the proper maintenance of the kiln to ensure kiln operations are executed effectively.
	Supervise the utilization of plant resources in the production unit operation, to ensure uninterrupted plant operations and employee/ plant safety.
	Address production process bottlenecks for a better output ,a greater stability of kiln operations and an improvement in environmental parameters.
	Coordinate housekeeping activities at the kiln and CCR.
	Provide input to the development of the standard operating procedures for assigned production section.
	Ensure compliance to relevant ISO standards.
	Oversee startups, shut down and operations in the kiln and section.
	Manage emergency situations to ensure adherence to standard procedures.
	Ensure process tests are conducted regularly to ensure that sensors in all lines function appropriately.
	Liaise with the shift Coordinator as necessary.
	Perform any other duties assigned by the GM, Production.


Requirements
Educational Qualification:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree or its equivalent in Engineering, Industrial Management, or a related field.


Experience:


	A minimum of 15 years of experience in production management, with at least 5 years in a senior management position in the manufacturing industry.

	In-depth knowledge of manufacturing processes and production management principles.
	Strong leadership and team management skills.
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
	Capacity for strategic thinking and planning.
	Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities.
	Proficiency in production management software and Microsoft Office Suite.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

	Private Health Insurance
	Paid Time Off
	Training and Development.

Assistant General Manager, Production Job at Dangote Group




        
    

        
        Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant General Manager, Production

Job Location: Okpella, Edo

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Assistant General Manager of Production at Dangote Group will be responsible for monitoring and coordination of all activities related to the poeration of the kiln and coal mills to achieve production and quality targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Responsible for meeting production volumes budget for the year
	Responsible for SHC, SPC and fuel mix as per budget.
	Ensure refractory work in kilns to have smooth and reliable run.
	Responsible for operational reliability of kilns and coal mills.
	Responsible for the implementation of all safety measures as required as per the company guidelines.
	Ensure production of high-quality. Clinker in the plant in accordance with pre-set quality standards.
	Oversee the proper maintenance of the kiln to ensure kiln operations are executed effectively.
	Supervise the utilization of plant resources in the production unit operation, to ensure uninterrupted plant operations and employee/ plant safety.
	Address production process bottlenecks for a better output ,a greater stability of kiln operations and an improvement in environmental parameters.
	Coordinate housekeeping activities at the kiln and CCR.
	Provide input to the development of the standard operating procedures for assigned production section.
	Ensure compliance to relevant ISO standards.
	Oversee startups, shut down and operations in the kiln and section.
	Manage emergency situations to ensure adherence to standard procedures.
	Ensure process tests are conducted regularly to ensure that sensors in all lines function appropriately.
	Liaise with the shift Coordinator as necessary.
	Perform any other duties assigned by the GM, Production.


Requirements
Educational Qualification:


	Bachelor’s degree or its equivalent in Engineering, Industrial Management, or a related field.


Experience:


	A minimum of 15 years of experience in production management, with at least 5 years in a senior management position in the manufacturing industry.


Skills and Competencies:


	In-depth knowledge of manufacturing processes and production management principles.
	Strong leadership and team management skills.
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
	Capacity for strategic thinking and planning.
	Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities.
	Proficiency in production management software and Microsoft Office Suite.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.


Benefits


	Private Health Insurance
	Paid Time Off
	Training and Development.
